title: Detectives Investigate Homicide in Landover
body:
Detectives are investigating a fatal
shooting in Landover. The victim is 30-year-old David Knott Jr. of Kipling
Parkway in District Heights. A reward of up to $25,000 is being offered for
information leading to an arrest and indictment in this case. Preliminarily, detectives
do not believe this was a random act. On January 4, at about 3:45 pm, patrol officers responded to the intersection of
Hill Road and Willow Hill Drive for the report of a shooting. When they
arrived, the officers discovered the victim inside of a SUV suffering from a
gunshot wound to the upper body. He was taken to the hospital where he was
pronounced dead on January 5.Detectives are working to identify a
suspect(s) and motive in this case.Anyone with
information on this case is asked to call the Homicide Unit at 301-772-4925.
Callers wishing to remain anonymous may call Crime Solvers at 1-866-411-TIPS (8477), or go online at www.pgcrimesolvers.com, or use the “P3 Tips” mobile app (search “P3 Tips” in
the Apple Store or Google Play to download the app onto your mobile device.)

Prince George's County Police
